N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 542.6 - Application for exception

State Regulations
(a) Individuals
seeking an exception to the prohibition against firearms described in section
542.5
of this Part shall apply in
writing to the commissioner or his or her designee or facility director. Applications shall be made on such forms as determined by the commissioner. Information required shall include, but not be limited to, the following: (1)
names(s) of individual(s) possessing the
firearm(s); (2)
certification that
the firearm(s) will only be used for the purposes authorized by section
542.5
of this Part; (3)
identification of all firearms, including
permit and/or registration numbers; and
(4)
identification and exact location of
proposed storage arrangements, including all safety mechanisms. (b) Individuals making application
to possess firearms shall be required to certify that they will comply with all
standards set forth in section
542.7
of this Part. (c) The final determination regarding the
request to possess a firearm must be in writing by the commissioner or his or
her designee or facility director. Notes
